a.g: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment."
He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner,
[Saying], 'Worship Allah, fear Him and obey me.
Allah will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allah, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew.' "
He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.
But my invitation increased them not except in flight.
And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments, persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.
Then I invited them publicly.
Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly
And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.
He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in [continuing] showers
And give you increase in wealth and children and provide for you gardens and provide for you rivers.

Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Miserliness
Know that Allah the Exalted has called wealth good in places in His Noble Book, so say He is Glorified and Exalted: "If he leaves good" the verse, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "How good is righteous wealth for a righteous man"[13], and all that comes regarding the reward of charity and pilgrimage is praise for wealth since it is not possible to reach them except through it. And He the Exalted said: "And He subjects for you what is in the heavens and what is on earth all from Him", and He the Exalted said, bestowing favor upon His servants: "And He will aid you with wealth and children and make for you gardens and make for you rivers", and He (peace be upon him) said: "Poverty almost becomes disbelief"[14], and this is praise for wealth. And you will not comprehend the aspect of reconciliation after blame and praise except by knowing the wisdom of wealth, its purpose, its harms, and its dangers; until it becomes clear to you that it is good from one aspect and evil from another aspect, and that it is praiseworthy from where it is good and blameworthy from where it is evil, for it is not pure good nor pure evil, but rather it is a cause for both matters, and what has this description is inevitably praised at times and blamed at others, but the discerning distinguisher perceives that the praiseworthy from it is not the blameworthy, and its clarification is by deriving from what we mentioned in the Book of Gratitude regarding the explanation of goods and the detailing of the degrees of blessings, and the sufficient amount in it is that the aim of the wise and the people of insight is the happiness of the Hereafter which is the everlasting bliss and the kingdom and the abiding. And aiming for this is the constant practice of the noble and the wise, for it was said to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him): Who are the most honorable of people and the wisest of them? He said: "The most frequent in remembrance (Dhikr) of death and the most prepared for it"[15]. And this happiness is not attained except through three means in the world, and they are the spiritual virtues, like knowledge and good character, and the bodily virtues: like health and safety, and the virtues external to the body: like wealth and other means. And the highest of them are the spiritual, then the bodily, then the external.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Fear and Hope
And therefore the Arabs expressed the Fear (Khauf) through Hope (Raja') as Allah the Exalted said: 'What is the matter with you that you do not hope for Allah with awe (Waqar)?' meaning you do not fear. And often in the Quran, Hope (Raja') comes with the meaning of Fear (Khauf), and that is due to their inseparability, as it is the custom of the Arabs to express a thing through what accompanies it.

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Foundations of Belief
And He (Exalted) said: 'Have you not seen how Allah created seven heavens in layers and made the moon therein a light and made the sun a lamp? And Allah has caused you to grow from the earth a growth. Then He will return you into it and extract you an extraction.' And He (Exalted) said: 'Then do you see what you emit? Is it you who creates it, or are We the Creator?' up to His saying: 'for the grateful.' So it is not hidden from one who possesses the slightest bit of intellect, if he contemplates with the least thought the content of these verses and directs his gaze upon the wonders of Allah's creation in the earth and the heavens and the marvels of the innate disposition (Fitra) of animals and plants, that this amazing affair and precise arrangement cannot do without a Maker who manages it and an Agent who governs it and determines it. Rather, the innate disposition (Fitra) of the souls (Nufus) almost testifies to being subdued under His subjugation and directed according to the requirement of His management. And for that reason Allah (Exalted) said: 'Is there doubt concerning Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth?'

That you may follow therein roads of passage.' "
Noah said, "My Lord, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him except in loss.
And they conspired an immense conspiracy.
And said, 'Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwa' or Yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr.
And already they have misled many. And, [my Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error."
Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allah [any] helpers.
And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant.

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Invocations and Supplications
By my father and mother, O Messenger of Allah, indeed Noah invoked against his people, saying: 'My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from the disbelievers a single dweller (Quran 71:26).' And if you had invoked against us with its like, we would have perished. For indeed your back was trampled, your face was bloodied, and your incisor was broken, yet you refused to say except good, so you said: 'O Allah, forgive my people, for they do not know.'
